sen.j: 椿井大塚山古墳（つばいおおつかやまこふん）は、京都府木津川市山城町に所在する古墳。
sen.e: Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun is a tumulus located in Yamashiro Cho of Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun is a tumulus located in Yamashiro Cho of Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun is a tumulus located in Yamashiro Town of Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 築造期は3世紀末で、山城地方最大の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: It was built at the end of the third century and is the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus in the Yamashiro region.
It was built at the end of the third century and is the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus in the Yamashiro region.
It was built at the end of the third century and is the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus in the Yamashiro region.

sen.j: 破壊が進んでいて、本来の規模については未だよく分かっていない。
sen.e: It has been destructed to such extent that its precise original size is unknown yet.
It has been destroyed to such extent that its precise original size is yet unknown.
It has been destroyed to such extent that its precise original size is yet unknown.

sen.j: 後円部はJR奈良線によって分断されている。
sen.e: JR Nara Line runs through its round part.
The JR Nara Line runs through its round part.
The JR Nara Line runs through its round part.

sen.j: 規模・形状
sen.e: Shape and size
Shape and size
Shape and Size

sen.j: 墳丘は全長約175メートル、後円部は直径約110m 高さ20m、前方部は長さ約80m 高さ約10mと推定されている。
sen.e: This tomb mound is estimated as follows: it was 175 m long; the round part was 110 m in diameter, 20 m in height; the rectangular part was approximately 80 m long, and approximately 10 m in height.
This tomb mound is estimated as follows: it was 175 m long; the round part was 110 m in diameter, 20 m in height; the rectangular part was approximately 80 m long, and approximately 10 m in height.

This tomb mound is estimated as follows: It was approximately 175 m long; the round part was approximately 110 m in diameter, 20 m in height; the rectangular part was approximately 80 m long, and approximately 10 m in height.

sen.j: 前方部が鉢形に開き、濠が認められていない。
sen.e: Its rectangular part is open like a pot, and no moat has been found.
Its rectangular part is open like a pot, and no moat has been found.
Its rectangular part is open like a pot, and no moat has been found.

sen.j: 水をたたえていない古墳は畿内では稀である。
sen.e: A tumulus without a moat of water is very rare in the Kinai region.
A tumulus without a moat of water is very rare in the Kinai region.
A tumulus without a moat of water is very rare in the Kinai Region (countries near Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 古墳は山塊の中に造営され、盛土も部分的に行ったもの。
sen.e: It was built in a hill, and clay was partly piled up to make a mound.
It was built in a hill, and clay was partly piled up to make the mound.
It was built in a hill, and clay was partly piled up to make the mound.

sen.j: 墳丘の大部分は自然地形の高まり、つまり、「山」を利用しているので、山と一体化し、山の一部になりきっている。
sen.e: Most of the mound makes use of a natural rise of land, or a hill, so it is completely part of the hill.
Most of the mound makes use of the natural rise of the land, or a hill, so it is completely part of the hill.
Most of the mound makes use of the natural rise of the land, or a 'hill,' so it is completely part of the hill.

sen.j: このような造り方は、最古級の古墳に多いという。
sen.e: This kind of structure is said to be found in many oldest tumuli.
This kind of structure is said to be found in many of the oldest tumuli.
This kind of structure is said to be found in many of the oldest tumuli.

sen.j: 埋葬施設は、定型化した竪穴式石室に長大な割竹型木棺を使用している。
sen.e: Its burial chamber is a stereotyped pit-type stone room and houses a large half-cylindrical trough type wooden coffin.
Its burial chamber is a stereotyped pit-type stone room and houses a large half-cylindrical trough type wooden coffin.
Its burial chamber is a stereotyped pit-type stone room and houses a large half-cylindrical trough type wooden coffin.

sen.j: 古墳時代初期の前方後円墳。
sen.e: It is a keyhole type tumulus built in the beginning of the Kofun period.
It is a keyhole type tumulus built during the beginning of the Kofun period.
It is a keyhole-shaped tumulus built during the beginning of the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 小林行雄は、三角縁神獣鏡を分類して七つの型式に大別した場合、この古墳の出土品では最古型式から4番目までの新しい鏡が含まれていたので、3世紀末とした。
sen.e: Yukio KOBAYASHI categorized Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Triangular Rim, Gods and Animals) into seven types, and he determined this tumulus was built at the end of the third century, because the excavated goods included mirrors of those types from the oldest to the fourth latest categories.

Yukio KOBAYASHI categorized the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Triangular Rim, Gods and Animals) into seven types, and he determined this tumulus was built at the end of the third century, because the excavated goods included mirrors of those types from the oldest to the fourth latest categories.

Yukio KOBAYASHI categorized the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Triangular Rim, Gods and Animals) into seven types, and he determined this tumulus was built at the end of the third century, because the excavated goods included mirrors of those types from the oldest to the fourth latest categories.

sen.j: しかし、近年では、この椿井大塚山古墳より若干遡り、3世紀中葉過ぎに定型化した前方後円墳が現れたと考えられている。
sen.e: Today, formulated keyhole type tumuli are considered to have been first built in the beginning of the second half of the third century, a little earlier than this Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus was built.

Today, formulated keyhole type tumuli are considered to have been first built in the beginning of the second half of the third century, a little earlier than this the Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus was built.

Today, formulated keyhole-shaped tumuli are considered to have been first built in the beginning of the second half of the third century, a little earlier than this the Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus was built.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 1953年（昭和28）、国鉄奈良線の拡幅工事の際に竪穴式石室が偶然発見され、当時最多の三角縁神獣鏡32面が出土した。
sen.e: In 1953, when construction of expanding the railroad width of Kokutetsu (Japanese Railway) Nara Line was under way, this pit-type stone room was accidentally discovered, and it revealed thirty-two Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors, the largest number at that time.

In 1953, when construction of expanding the railroad width of Kokutetsu (Japanese Railway) Nara Line was under way, this pit-type stone room was accidentally discovered, and it revealed thirty-two Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors, the largest number at that time.

In 1953, when construction of expanding the railroad width of Kokutetsu (Japanese Railway) Nara Line was under way, this pit-type stone room was accidentally discovered, and it revealed 32 Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors, the largest number at that time.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 内行花文鏡2面、方格規矩鏡1面、画文帯神獣鏡1面など計36面以上の鏡と武具が出土した。
sen.e: Armors and a total of thirty-six or more mirrors including two Naiko Kamonkyo Mirrors (Mirrors with Linked Bow Pattern), a Hokakukikukyo Mirror (Mirror with TLV Pattern), and a Gamontai Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Figures of Deities and Sacred Animals) were excavated.

Armor and a total of thirty-six or more mirrors including two Naiko Kamonkyo Mirrors (Mirrors with Linked Bow Pattern), a Hokakukikukyo Mirror (Mirror with TLV Pattern), and a Gamontai Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Figures of Deities and Sacred Animals) were excavated.

Armor and a total of 36 or more mirrors including two Naiko Kamonkyo Mirrors (Mirrors with Linked Bow Pattern), a Hokakukikukyo Mirror (Mirror with TLV Pattern), and a Gamontai Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with Figures of Deities and Sacred Animals) were excavated.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 36面以上というのは他の鏡の破片数点が出ているのと盗掘で行方不明になったものがあった可能性が出てきたためであった。
sen.e: The number thirty-six or more was estimated from the fact that a few fractions of other mirrors were found and from the possibility that some items are lost because of grave robbing.
The number thirty-six or more was estimated from the fact that a few fractions of other mirrors were found and from the possibility that some items were lost because of grave robbing.
The number 36 or more was estimated from the fact that a few fractions of other mirrors were found and from the possibility that some items were lost because of grave robbing.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 多数の銅鏡を棺の中に入れる習俗が古墳時代前期には西日本や中部地方で急速に拡がった。
sen.e: The practice of placing many bronze mirrors in a coffin rapidly spread in the western and the central part of Japan in the beginning of the Kofun period.
The practice of placing many bronze mirrors in a coffin rapidly spread in the western and the central part of Japan during the beginning of the Kofun period.
The practice of placing many bronze mirrors in a coffin rapidly spread in the western and Chubu region of Japan during the beginning of the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: それらの鏡が、短期間にほぼ同一場所・地域で製作されたと推定されている。
sen.e: Those mirrors are considered to have been manufactured in a particular place or region in a short period of time.
Those mirrors are considered to have been manufactured in a particular place or region over a short period of time.
Those mirrors are considered to have been manufactured in a particular place or region over a short period of time.

sen.j: また、日本最古の刀子も出土している。
sen.e: The oldest Tosu (a small knife) in Japan also came out.
The oldest Tosu (a small knife) in Japan was also found.
The oldest Tosu (a small knife) in Japan was also found.

sen.j: 武器・武具では、鉄刀7本以上、鉄剣十数本以上、鉄矛7本以上、鉄族約200本、銅族17本、鉄製甲冑1領が、工具・農具では、鉄鎌3本、鉄斧10個、鉄刀17本、鉄製ヤリカンナ7本以上、鉄錐8本以上、鉄ノミ3本以上が、漁具では、鉄銛十数本、鉄ヤス数本、鉄製釣針1本が出土している。
sen.e: Excavated articles from this tumulus include: (1) weapons and armors: seven or more iron daggers, a dozen or more iron swords, seven or more pikes, about two hundred iron arrowheads, seventeen bronze arrowheads, and a suit of iron armor; (2) tools and farming utensils: three iron sickles, ten iron adz, seventeen iron knives, seven or more iron yariganna (spear planes), eight or more iron cores, and three or more iron chisels; (3) fishing gears: about a dozen iron harpoons, a few iron fish spears, and an iron fish hook.
sen.cmt: 「族」の意味が不明です．漢字の誤りと思われます．「鏃」（矢じり）を意味するものと判断いたしました．参考(http://bunka.nii.ac.jp/SearchDetail.do?heritageId=127871)
sen.e: Excavated articles from this tumulus include: (1) weapons and armor: seven or more iron daggers, a dozen or more iron swords, seven or more pikes, about two hundred iron arrowheads, seventeen bronze arrowheads, and a suit of iron armor; (2) tools and farming utensils: three iron sickles, ten iron adz, seventeen iron knives, seven or more iron yariganna (spear planes), eight or more iron cores, and three or more iron chisels; (3) fishing gear: about a dozen iron harpoons, a few iron fish spears, and an iron fish hook.

Excavated articles from this tumulus include: (1) weapons and armor: seven or more iron daggers, more than 10 iron swords, seven or more pikes, about 200 iron arrowheads, 17 bronze arrowheads, and a suit of iron armor; (2) tools and farming utensils: three iron sickles, 10 iron adz, 17 iron knives, seven or more iron yariganna (spear planes), eight or more iron cores, and three or more iron chisels; (3) fishing gear: more than 10 iron harpoons, a few iron fish spears, and an iron fish hook.

sen.j: このほか、鉄製冠ではないかと疑われる鉄製品がでている。
sen.e: An iron article that is suspected to be an iron-made crown was also found.
An iron article that is suspected to be an iron-made crown was also found.
An iron article that is suspected to be an iron-made crown was also found.

sen.j: 当古墳は、淀川を遡り木津川の右岸にある。
sen.e: This tumulus lies to the right side of Kizu-gawa River, one of the tributary rivers of Yodo-gawa River.
This tumulus lies to the right side of Kizu-gawa River, one of the tributary rivers of Yodo-gawa River.
This tumulus lies to the right side of the Kizu-gawa River, one of the tributary rivers of the Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 縄文時代からの漁具である銛、ヤス、釣針が揃っている。
sen.e: Its held all the fishing gears that had been used since the Jomon period (about ten thousand years before the third century B.C.): harpoons, fish spears, and fish hooks.
It held all the fishing gear that had been used since the Jomon period (about ten thousand years before third century B.C.): harpoons, fish spears, and fish hooks.
It held all the fishing gear that had been used since the Jomon period (about ten thousand years before third century B.C.): Harpoons, fish spears, and fish hooks.

sen.j: 南西に船戸という地名がある。
sen.e: There is a place called 'Funado' (literally, ship door) to the southwest.
There is a place called 'Funado' (literally, ship door) to the southwest.
There is a place called Funado (literally, ship door) to the southwest.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: などから当古墳の被葬者は船舶の管理者であり、津（港）の管掌者ではなかったかと推測されている。
sen.e: From these facts, the owner of this tumulus is thought to have controlled ships and ports in this region.
From these facts, the owner of this tumulus is thought to have controlled ships and ports in this region.
From these facts, the owner of this tumulus is thought to have controlled ships and ports in this region.
